result.execSummary:
The defendant Ehtoo La was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Request to waive sex offender reporting made by defense; State takes no position. The Court sets forth findings under Sec. 301.45; defense request to waive reporting granted by the Court.

miscConds.notes:
-Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges (including DNA), fees, assessments and costs by the end of probation period-any remaing balance to convert to civil judgment (collection under Wis. Stat. 71.935)
-Restitution set at zero.
Defendant informed he may not possess and/or own any firearms.

-No involvement in conduct rising to the level of finding of probable cause;
-No contact with victim as follows: during term of probation: ONLY if victim agrees and notifies the agent and agent agrees/IF REVOKED NO CONTACT

-Defendant ordered to provide DNA sample
-Defendant is informed he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated
-The defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program
-The Court allows the defendant to travel to Chicago, IL and/or Minneapolis/St. Paul, MN for the purpose of counseling and treatment

-Obtain AODA assessment and complete follow-up care/treatment
-Cooperate with sex offender evaulation and cooperate with recommended treatment and counseling

timeConds.notes: Release privileges for employment, counseling and treatment with NO good time allowed-STAYED for agent use.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ehtoo La

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (31 pages) commencing NOVEMBER 19, 2015 received and filed.
Karen Interpreter
6 letters as to sentencing submitted on behalf of the defendant, received and filed.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab
Defense sentencing memorandum received and filed. sab

Defendant Ehtoo La in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Wilfred Tun Baw sworn as Karen interpreter.
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised the defendant he may be subject to the sex offender registry and he was advised of the penalties of violating a no contact order if one is imposed. Case calendared for SENTENCING in Branch 15. Clerk emailed interpreter coordinator with the sentencing date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Ehtoo La in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
A Karen interpreter was not available for todays date. Case rescheduled for PROJECTED PLEA In Branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Ehtoo La in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however defense requests more time to obtain a Karen interpreter for the plea hearing.  Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Filed, Justice Point Report dated 10/2/2015.

Defendant Ehtoo La in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB

Defendant Ehtoo La in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is requesting a DISPOSITIVE MOTION HEARING.
All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15,  in Room 502 SB.
Court will set a hearing date of 8-27-2015 at 1:30pm Branch 15.  Motion to be filed within 21 days of today's date.

Defendant Ehtoo La in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Brostrom.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 38 for Branch 15.
Vacate 7-17-2015, 7-30-2015 and 9-2-2015 dates.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.
MOTION TO SUPPRESS STATEMENTS & OTHER EVIDENCE

Defendant Ehtoo La in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Due to problems with disc, defendant's motion to adjourn granted by the court. 
Case is adjourned for motion hearing, final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 10.
Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Ehtoo La in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  Cindy L. Davis (for Erin Karshen) appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Filed, original information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty, and requests plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

Stipulation to the No Contact Order to be amended as follows. Agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court. Defendant can have supervised visits with SL (1/10/15) and SL (7/5/06).  Visits will be supervised by Tim Lee and Mai Her Lee. No contact with MPL remains the same.

Defendant Ehtoo La in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Court ordered case adjourned for arraignment to Branch 10.  Arraignment scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Filed. Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/27/15.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MPL dob 6/18/97; SL dob 1/10/15 or SL dob 7/5/06 or the address of the incident

Defendant Ehtoo La in court with attorney Robert J. Dvorak.  Defendant Ehtoo La in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
